results.title: Play School. Special; Concert
results.brief_description: Appearing in the “Play school special” are eight well-loved Play school presenters: Benita Collings, Merridy Eastman, John Hamblin, Noni Hazelhurst, Jennifer Ludlum, Philip Quast, Don Spencer and John Waters. Favourite songs include ‘Old Macdonald’, ‘Baa baa black sheep’, ‘The paper song’, ‘There’s a bear in there’ and many more. Some of the stories are ‘Harry the dirty dog’, ‘There was a princess’ and ‘The hole’. Benita Collings and John Hamblin perform in a Play School concert. The audience joins in with the words and actions of popular Play school songs. Among them are ‘I’m a little teapot’ and ‘Bananas in pyjamas’.

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Wharfies: A History of the Waterside Worker's Federation
results.brief_description: Wharfies traces the history of the Australian Waterside Workers Federation from its foundation in 1902, under Billy Hughes, to the present day. Made in the tradition of the Waterside Workers Film Unit of the 1950s, “Wharfies” covers important historical events including industrial milestones, political crises and the stories of the men themselves. This film is pieced together through dramatised sequences, interviews with veteran wharfies and rare archival footage. Cartoons, news clippings and old photographs all help to tell the story.

results.title: Soldier settlers
results.brief_description: Portrays the progress made since 1945 in the establishment of ex-servicemen from World War II on Victorian land. The division of large estates, the development of existing pastures, the clearing of scrub country and the construction of irrigation channels are seen on representative farms throughout the state. Fruit growing, the dried fruit industry, wheat cultivation and sheep raising, plus dry and irrigated dairying are shown, in addition to the single-unit farm system.

results.title: Land Bilong Islanders
results.creator_credit: Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly, Channel 4, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Yarra Bank Films
results.brief_description: Murray Island, a tiny speck in the Coral Sea, on the northernmost fringe of Australia’s Great Barrier Reef is one of the most beautiful and isolated places in Australia, if not the world. However, Murray Island, or Mer as it is called by the Merlam people, is the centre of a legal battle that questions the very basis of European settlement in Australia. Three Murray Islanders have taken the Queensland and Australian Governments to court claiming that islanders, not the State, own island land. They say that in Merlam law and custom their families had, since time immemorial, distinct rights to the land and to adjoining seabeds and reefs. Islanders argue that those rights continued after the island was annexed to the then British Colony of Queensland.

results.title: The Quest of Jimmy Pike
results.creator_credit: I. James Wilson, John Tristram and Juniper Films
results.brief_description: A member of the Walmajarri tribe, Jimmy Pike walked out of the Great Sandy Desert in the remote north-west of Western Australia when he was 14 years old. Today, his exciting, brilliantly-coloured prints and paintings can be seen in every State gallery in Australia. Most major department stores carry a wide range of sportswear, bed linen and other items bearing his innovative designs. Overseas, his work has achieved extraordinary popularity.

results.title: Handmaidens and battleaxes
results.brief_description: This is an informative and entertaining documentary which traces the role of nurses from pre-industrial times to the modern day. The program uses rare archival footage, dramatic re-enactments, personal interviews and photographic stills collected from nursing colleges from three continents. These elements successfully combine to give insight into the reality of the nursing profession.

results.title: On your marks it's bright sparks. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Mark Lamprell, Jeff Gale and Pru Donovan
results.brief_description: Planes, Trains, Boats and Cars: Sparky, Amy and Alex discover floating bikes, underwater boats, trucks without drivers, trains without trucks, cars that become boats and planes that become helicopters. But can Alex really turn his BMX bike into an excavator to drill a hole to China? “Water, Water, Everywhere”: Planet Earth should be called Planet Water says Sparky, as he flies Amy and Alex around the world to see why. From the Amazon River to the River Nile and even Antarctica, Amy and Alex see how water is a wonderful gift - to be used, enjoyed and shared by everyone.

results.title: Musical Tales
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, John Hosier and Elizabeth Bennett
results.brief_description: This beautifully animated puppet film presents four of your favourite stories set to the great classical music of Tschaikovsky, Stravinsky and Delibes. Featurees “The Nutcracker and the Mouse King”, “Petrushka”, “Coppelia” and “Sleeping Beauty”.

results.title: David to the Rescue
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg and Micheline Charest
results.brief_description: David is always ready to help his fellow creatures out of trouble - but that usually leads him into adventure. “David to the Rescue” - David goes to Italy to attend a sick Gnome child. Finding the healing flower is a challenge which only he can handle. “The Baby Troll” - A baby Troll is stuck on a rock in the middle of the river. David must call upon a friend to help save him.

results.title: Felix the Cat
results.brief_description: A bag of high flying adventure with Felix the Cat. See Felix pull all elevators and airplanes out of his magic bag of tricks and fly to the moon with Pointdexter. Watch Felix capture Rock Bottom and delight in the antics of the professor. It’s all here in an hour of fun! Rated: G
